poem:
### The Madre Fire

A map folded, scorched edges curling  
as ink bleeds into the parched land.  
Smoke scribes the sky with whispered  
legends, tales of flame's brief kingdom—  
embers of yesterday still glowing,  
like footprints in ash, where silence  
marks the reigns of forgotten rains.  
Air hums an orange lament,  
the earth sighs a burnt epilogue.
